slides.title: <mark>5 Micro-Boundaries</mark> to Protect Your Focus This Week

slides.body:
Tiny fences stop giant distractions.

Say clearly once. Prevent repeated interruptions.

Here are <mark>5 micro-boundaries</mark> you can set today:

slides.title: <mark>Link closes at 6 p.m.</mark>
slides.body:
End work by leaving the doc in draft.

Rename with 'v0.1' + date. Stage comments. Close the tab.

Closed loops protect your evening and reset focus for tomorrow.

slides.title: <mark>Camera off until agenda</mark>
slides.body:
Meet with intention.

Default to audio unless purpose and outcomes are shared. Request agenda 1 hour before. Decline fuzzy invites.

Clear expectations save attention and prevent meeting drift.

slides.title: <mark>Phone silent in focus blocks</mark>
slides.body:
Create noise-canceling windows.

Calendar the block. Turn on DND. Whitelist true emergencies. Notify contacts.

Temporary silence yields lasting progress.

slides.title: <mark>Reply windows</mark>
slides.body:
Contain the inbox.

Check messages at set times: 10 a.m., 2 p.m., 5 p.m. Use quick templates. Disable badges in between.

You decide when attention goes there, not the ping.

slides.title: <mark>Workspace reset</mark>
slides.body:
Start and end the day with order.

Clear the desk. Stage water and the current project. Close unrelated tabs.

A tidy zone cues focus and invites calm.
Which micro-boundary will you say once to save hours later?
